name: plzLike
tagline: A jQuery plugin for Facebook like-gates, backed by Firebase or custom endpoint.
body:
**plzLike** was created to make it easier to run like-based Facebook promotions (giveaways, contests, etc).  
  
A [recent TOS change by Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/facebookforbusiness/news/page-promotions-terms) marked an easing up on rules - the main point is now simply to display a "..not endorsed by.." statement.  
  
[Firebase](https://www.firebase.com/) is a "real time back-end" allowing data storage and access from **client-side** code... with a **great free tier**. Using Firebase allows the plugin to be used from any page, collecting entrants without a back-end care in the world (not to mention the crazy real-time Firebase features that this project doesn't make use of)  

## Features
* Step users through **"liking" your page** and **"entering" your promotion**
* Store entrants list in [cloud storage](https://www.firebase.com/)
* Configurable markup for the entry steps

## Usage
0. **Requirements**  
  1. Facebook App ID
  2. Facebook page to target (e.g. https://www.facebook.com/ **Page Name** )
  3. [Firebase](http://firebase.com) URL (sign up first)

1. **Include jQuery:**
	```html
	<script src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.0.0/jquery.min.js"></script>
	```

2. **Data store:**  
  Sign up for [Firebase](http://firebase.com) and include firebase script:
	```html
	<!-- End of body, or somewhere in head if you must -->
	<script type='text/javascript' src='https://cdn.firebase.com/v0/firebase.js'></script>
	```

3. **Include plzLike:**
	```html
	<!-- Up in da head -->
	<link href="dist/jquery.plzlike.min.css" rel="stylesheet"/>

	<!-- After jQuery -->
	<script src="dist/jquery.plzlike.min.js"></script>
	```
4. **Call the plugin:**
	```javascript
	$("#element").plzLike({
		appId: <Facebook App ID>,
		page: <Facebook Page name>,
		firebaseUrl: <Firebase URL>
	});
	```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
